devdoc.author: Karen Suen

confirmItemReceived(uint256).details: Buyer confirms delivery of item from seller and escrow funds held in this transaction is released to the seller. The transaction must be in the correct state (AWAITING_DELIVERY) to be confirmed

params._id: Transaction id to confirm and release funds

fundTransaction(uint256,address).details: Receives and holds buyer's funds for purchasing a listing and updates the state of the corresponding transaction.

params._buyer: The buyer address that is sending the funds

getAllUserTransactions(address).details: Return the list of all transaction ids involving the given account

params._user: The account address to retrieve all transactions for

getTransaction(uint256).details: Returns all information about a transaction as a tuple

getTransactionStatus(uint256).details: Return the current status of the given transaction id

params._id: Transaction id to retrieve status of

startTransaction(uint256,address,address.details: Create a new transaction for the given listing, new transactions always starts in AWAITING_PAYMENT state.

params._amount: The agreed selling price of listing
params._buyer: The buyer address of the listing
params._id: The listing id that will be used for this transaction's id
params._seller: The seller address that created the listing

devdoc.title: A contract for managing trading of funds between buyers and sellers

userdoc.notice: This contract manages all transactions between buyers and sellers in the marketplace. When a buyer commits to purchasing a listing, a new transaction is created and buyer's purchase funds are held in this Escrow contract until the buyer confirms successfully delivery of the item from seller. New transactions are started by creating a new Transaction struct. Transactions are identified using the listing id and each listing can only have 1 ongoing transaction at a time.
